H0.text: They insulate against cold air, which is the primary way that evergreen trees planted on the north and west sides of residences in Massachusetts help reduce winter heating costs.

H1.text: They optimize solar heating, which is the primary way that evergreen trees planted on the north and west sides of residences in Massachusetts help reduce winter heating costs.

H2.text: They reduce radiant cooling, which is the primary way that evergreen trees planted on the north and west sides of residences in Massachusetts help reduce winter heating costs.

H3.text: They act as a windbreak, which is the primary way that evergreen trees planted on the north and west sides of residences in Massachusetts help reduce winter heating costs.

A4.text: If designed properly, windbreaks around a home can reduce the cost of heating and cooling and save energy.

A5.text: Windbreaks reduce the wind's average air speed and make it less variable, resulting in the wind mixing less effectively than it does upwind.
